About me

Colour grading • Cinematography • Software development

For quite some time now, I've been deeply passionate about colour grading, cinematography, and software development; this website is designed to showcase the various projects I’ve worked on in these three fields.

When I was 8, I realized that I could share the stories I made up with my toy cars, simply by taking thousands of pictures of them and editing them together on the family computer. This interest in stop-motion slowly progressed into a more general interest in content creation and filmmaking, which I've now narrowed down to cinematography and colour grading — although I still very much enjoy other aspects of this process, such as editing, visual effects, sound editing, etc...

In parallel, I discovered programming, which not only supported my interest in filmmaking by letting me develop specialized tools, but also tell its own stories, through web development, for example.

These disciplines all require a blend of creative and technical skills, each complementing the other, which is perhaps what I enjoy most about them: the magic of mastering a technical skill to translate an idea into reality never wears off, and pushes me to always continue learning about and exploring these fields
